result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Lee Powless

records.addlTxt: ACJ payment receipt, Bail Bond Info Sheet from ACJ, Notice RE Posting Bond form and a copy of signed cash bond
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:21 PM Defendant Steven Lee Powless appeared by phone.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Steven Lee Powless.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF129, 21CF251, 21CM161, and 22CF114.  Atty is still not appointed in 21CF251, attorney sending PD office a note.  Def sentenced last week, working with State for offer.  State asking for an opportunity to come to resolution with Atty.  If cases not resolved at next status they will be set for trial.  Def phone 414-400-7334.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Oct 31;  ka
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant Steven Lee Powless appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court.  Cases 21CF129, 21CF251, 21CM161, and 22CF114.  Tried contacting by phone, sent email, responded that she is calling in now.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Steven Lee Powless. Atty, def waiving prelim hearings, Atty is satisfied, Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court finds PC the def committed felony in Ashland County and bound over for arraignment.  State is filing information now, contain same charges.  Atty arraignment now, understands charges and penalties, waive reading, pleas NG, noted.  21CM161 is tracking along.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Sept 2;  ka

2:01 PM Defendant Steven Lee Powless appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Steven Lee Powless.  21CF129,21CF251,21CM161,22CF114-- Atty comments-- Rec'd compl, in the two cases 21CF129,21CM161-- Atty is not on cases 21CF251,22CF114- Back on the record (2:09) Ct comments on the cases schd for hearings today. Atty comments- been in contact with the def, knows the def does have the new compls, Def would like to waive prelim in each of the cases. Def understands he needs to contact SPD to get atty apt'd on the new cases. Ct will complete the init and schd prelims in the cases. State comments on bail/bond. Atty comments on bail/bond. 
Ct orders-- 22CF114 to the current bail that is ordered, def does NOT need to sign a new bail. 
Atty and Def will go in a break out room, (2:16pm)  (Back on the record (2:39pm) Atty comments asking for a prelim in the new case, but will waive right on the other cases, but will waive TL for the prelim the in new case. 
Ct is not sure what case the def wants a prelim in is, Ct finds the def know and vol waives TL For the prelims.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Covers all three cases- 21CF129,21CF251,21CM161
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. Can be at Bad River Casino for work only
